info.title: CF-Log API
info.description:
CrossFit Training Log & Analytics API v14.4.0.

Tracks strength working sets (one row per set) and conditioning/benchmark results (metcons).
Organized by training cycles (1-8) and weeks (1-4 per cycle, 32 total).
Supports iso_week for ISO week numbering.

Key rules:
- Use /workouts/bulk to log multiple sets in one call (preferred over single POST)
- After saving, call GET /workouts/verify to confirm data was stored correctly
- Use /day_summary when the user asks about a specific training day (returns both workouts and metcons)
- For the most recent set, use /workouts?exercise=X&limit=1 or /search_exercise
- For the most recent metcon, use /metcons?name=X&limit=1
- Exercise names are auto-normalized to Title Case
- Tags are auto-normalized to lowercase
- Dates must be YYYY-MM-DD format
- iso_week is supported on both workouts and metcons for ISO week tracking

get.summary: Health check — confirms the API is up and the database is connected. Use this to diagnose connectivity issues before logging data.

200.description: Health status including DB connection state and type

get.summary: Get everything logged for a training day — both strength sets AND metcons in one call. Use this FIRST when the user asks about a specific day.

200.description: Day summary with workouts and metcons

post.summary: Log a single working set. Returns the saved workout with its ID. For multiple sets, prefer /workouts/bulk instead.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Skip duplicate check — set to true to force save even if a duplicate is detected

200.description: Saved workout with assigned ID

409.description: Duplicate detected — use force=true to override

get.summary: Query workouts with optional filters. Returns up to 'limit' rows (default 200). Use this for broad queries; use /workouts/search for fuzzy exercise name matching.

200.description: List of workouts matching the filters

post.summary: PREFERRED: Log multiple working sets in one call. Send one WorkoutIn per set. Always call /workouts/verify after to confirm data was saved correctly.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Skip duplicate check — set to true to force save even if duplicates are detected

200.description: Bulk save result with count and IDs of saved rows

409.description: Duplicates detected — use force=true to override

get.summary: Verify saved workout data via GET — checks that the expected number of sets were stored for a given date. Use this after saving to confirm data integrity. Accepts query parameters instead of a request body.

parameters.name: expected_sets
parameters.description: Expected number of sets — if provided, match will be true only if actual equals expected

200.description: Verification result with match status and all logged data for the date

delete.summary: Delete the N most recently added workout rows. Use to undo a mistaken bulk insert or correct a data entry error.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of most recent rows to delete (max 50)

200.description: Undo result with deleted IDs

put.summary: Edit an existing workout by ID. Send the full updated workout data — all fields will be overwritten. Use this to correct mistakes in a previously logged set.

200.description: Updated workout

delete.summary: Delete a specific workout by ID. Use this to remove a single incorrectly logged set when you know its ID.

200.description: Deleted

get.summary: Search for an exercise by name and return all matching logged sets. Use this when the user asks to look up a specific exercise with optional cycle/week/day/tag filters.

200.description: Exercise name and all matching logged sets

post.summary: Log a conditioning workout / benchmark result. Returns the saved metcon with its ID. Set score fields based on workout_type: score_time_seconds for timed WODs, score_rounds + score_reps for AMRAP.

200.description: Saved metcon with assigned ID

422.description: Validation error (bad date, invalid workout_type, invalid rx)

get.summary: Query metcons with optional filters. Returns up to 'limit' rows (default 200). Use this for broad metcon queries with multiple filter options.

parameters.name: workout_type
parameters.description: for_time, amrap, emom, chipper, interval, other

200.description: List of metcons matching the filters

post.summary: Log multiple metcon results in one call. Use this when the user provides several conditioning workout results at once.

200.description: Bulk save result with count and IDs of saved metcons

get.summary: Search metcons by name with optional filters. Use when the user asks about a conditioning workout by name (e.g. 'How did I do on Fran?').

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Metcon name or part of it

parameters.name: workout_type
parameters.description: for_time, amrap, emom, chipper, interval, other

200.description: Matching metcons (max 500)

put.summary: Edit an existing metcon result by ID. Send the full updated metcon data — all fields will be overwritten. Use this to correct a previously logged conditioning result.

200.description: Updated metcon

delete.summary: Delete a metcon result by ID. Use this to remove an incorrectly logged conditioning workout.

200.description: Deleted

get.summary: Overall stats: total workout sets, total metcons, best value per exercise, and the last workout logged. Use this for a quick overview of the entire training log.

200.description: Stats overview

get.summary: Personal records — highest value logged per exercise. Use to answer 'what is my PR for X?' or to list all PRs across all exercises.

parameters.name: exercise
parameters.description: Filter to one exercise (exact match, case-insensitive). Omit to get all PRs.

200.description: PRs map (exercise name -> best value)

get.summary: Estimate 1RM from logged sets using Epley or Brzycki formula. Uses the set that produces the highest estimate. Use to answer 'what is my estimated one-rep max for X?'

200.description: Estimated 1RM with source data (weight and reps used in calculation)

get.summary: Training volume per exercise (sets x reps x weight). Filter by cycle/week or date range. Use to assess total load and compare volume across exercises or time periods.

200.description: Volume breakdown per exercise with grand totals

get.summary: Exercise history — best value per date. Use to show strength progression over time and visualize trends for a specific exercise.

200.description: Timeline data points sorted by date

get.summary: Best scores for benchmarks. For timed WODs = fastest time, for AMRAP = most rounds+reps. Use to answer 'what is my best Fran time?' or 'show all my benchmark PRs'.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter by metcon name (partial match). Omit for all benchmarks.

parameters.name: rx
parameters.description: Filter by rx status (rx, scaled, rx_plus)

200.description: Benchmark PRs

get.summary: History of a named metcon over time — use to track benchmark progress, show improvement, and visualize conditioning performance trends.

200.description: Metcon timeline data with all attempts in chronological order

get.summary: How often each exercise appears in training — shows session count, total sets, and first/last date. Use to assess training variety, identify neglected movements, or check exercise selection balance.

200.description: Movement frequency data with exercise list and totals

get.summary: Break down sets by rep bracket: heavy (1-3 reps), strength (4-6), hypertrophy (7-12), endurance (13+). Use to analyze training style and assess if rep ranges match the user's goals.

200.description: Intensity distribution with brackets and set/rep counts per bracket

get.summary: Per-week metrics for an exercise across weeks — best value, average, total sets, total reps, total volume per week. Use to assess progression, stability, or stalls across training weeks.

parameters.name: cycle
parameters.description: Filter to a specific cycle. Omit for all cycles.

200.description: Week-over-week metrics for the exercise

get.summary: Sets and volume per training day — shows how much work is done each session. Use to assess fatigue accumulation, session load distribution, and identify overloaded training days.

200.description: Training density per day with averages and total training days

get.summary: Trend direction and slope for an exercise — uses best value per session with linear regression. Use to determine if performance is increasing, decreasing, or stable over time.

200.description: Trend analysis with slope, direction, recent average, and overall average

get.summary: Export all workout (strength set) data as CSV text. Use this when the user wants to download or back up their workout data. Includes iso_week column.

200.description: CSV export with row count and CSV text content

get.summary: Export all metcon/conditioning data as CSV text. Use this when the user wants to download or back up their metcon data. Includes iso_week column.

200.description: CSV export with row count and CSV text content

HealthOut.description: Health check response showing API and database status

ok.description: True if the API and DB are healthy

db_connected.description: True if the database is reachable

timestamp.description: UTC ISO timestamp of the health check

DaySummaryOut.description: Everything logged for a specific cycle/week/day — both workouts and metcons combined

WorkoutIn.description: One working set. Send one of these per set performed. Exercise names are auto-normalized to Title Case. Tags are auto-normalized to lowercase.

date.description: YYYY-MM-DD format, must be a valid calendar date

set_number.description: Which working set (1, 2, 3...). Required for duplicate detection.

value.description: Weight in kg, time in sec, or calories

unit.description: kg, lbs, sec, cal, m, min

iso_week.description: ISO week number (1-53) for ISO week-based tracking

WorkoutOut.description: A saved workout set with its database ID and all fields

BulkWorkoutIn.description: Wrapper for bulk workout insertion — contains an array of WorkoutIn objects

BulkWorkoutOut.description: Result of a bulk workout insertion

MetconIn.description: A conditioning/benchmark workout result. Set score fields based on workout_type: score_time_seconds for timed WODs, score_rounds + score_reps for AMRAP. Metcon name is auto-normalized to Title Case.

name.description: Metcon name (auto-normalized to Title Case). E.g. 'Fran', 'Murph'

score_time_seconds.description: Total time in seconds (for for_time WODs)

score_reps.description: Extra reps beyond last full round (for AMRAP)

iso_week.description: ISO week number (1-53) for ISO week-based tracking

MetconOut.description: A saved metcon result with its database ID and all fields

BulkMetconIn.description: Wrapper for bulk metcon insertion — contains an array of MetconIn objects

BulkMetconOut.description: Result of a bulk metcon insertion

ids.description: Database IDs of saved metcon rows

VerifyOut.description: Verification result — confirms whether the expected number of sets match what is actually stored

match.description: true if expected_sets == actual_sets (or actual > 0 if expected not given)

logged.description: All logged sets matching the verification criteria

UndoOut.description: Result of an undo operation — lists the IDs that were deleted

SearchExerciseOut.description: Search result for an exercise — includes the search term and all matching logged sets

exercise.description: The exercise name that was searched

MetconPROut.description: Best score for a named benchmark

best_time_seconds.description: Fastest time in seconds (for timed WODs)

best_reps.description: Extra reps in best AMRAP attempt

metcon_id.description: Database ID of the PR metcon row

MetconTimelinePointOut.description: A single data point in a metcon timeline

MetconTimelineOut.description: Timeline of all attempts for a named metcon, sorted chronologically

StatsOut.description: Overall training stats — totals and bests

bests.description: Best value per exercise (exercise name -> highest value)

VolumeOut.description: Volume data for a single exercise

total_volume.description: Sum of (value x reps) across all sets

WeeklyVolumeOut.description: Volume breakdown per exercise with grand totals

TimelinePointOut.description: A single data point in an exercise timeline

ExerciseTimelineOut.description: Exercise history — best value per date with set and rep counts

MovementFrequencyItemOut.description: Frequency data for a single exercise

session_count.description: Number of distinct training days this exercise appears

total_sets.description: Total number of sets logged for this exercise

first_date.description: First date this exercise was logged (YYYY-MM-DD)

last_date.description: Most recent date this exercise was logged (YYYY-MM-DD)

MovementFrequencyOut.description: Movement frequency analysis — how often each exercise appears in training

exercises.description: Exercises sorted by total sets descending

total_unique_exercises.description: Total number of unique exercises in the result

period_start.description: Start date filter applied (YYYY-MM-DD) or null

period_end.description: End date filter applied (YYYY-MM-DD) or null

IntensityBracketOut.description: A single intensity bracket (e.g. heavy, strength, hypertrophy, endurance)

bracket.description: Bracket name: heavy, strength, hypertrophy, or endurance

sets.description: Number of sets in this bracket

avg_value.description: Average weight/value in this bracket. Null if no weight was recorded.

max_value.description: Max weight/value in this bracket. Null if no weight was recorded.

IntensityDistributionOut.description: Breakdown of sets by rep-based intensity brackets

brackets.description: Only brackets with at least one set are included

WeekMetricsOut.description: Metrics for a single week of an exercise

avg_value.description: Average value across all sets this week

total_sets.description: Number of sets logged this week

total_volume.description: Total volume (value x reps) this week

WeekOverWeekOut.description: Week-over-week metrics for an exercise across multiple training weeks

weeks.description: Metrics per week, sorted by cycle then week

DayDensityOut.description: Training density data for a single day

total_exercises.description: Number of unique exercises this day

total_volume.description: Total volume (value x reps) this day

exercises.description: List of exercise names performed this day (sorted alphabetically)

TrainingDensityOut.description: Training density analysis — sets and volume per day with averages

days.description: Per-day density data sorted by date

total_training_days.description: Total number of training days in the period

TrendOut.description: Trend analysis for an exercise — linear regression on best values per session

data_points.description: Number of distinct training dates with data

slope_per_session.description: Linear regression slope — positive means improving, negative means declining

recent_avg.description: Average of the 3 most recent session best values

overall_avg.description: Average of all session best values

CsvExportOut.description: CSV export result — contains the filename, row count, and full CSV text

rows.description: Number of data rows in the CSV

csv.description: Full CSV content as a string (includes header row)
